intro: Lantana lockhardtii, commonly known as the wild lantana, is a shrub native to Mexico and the Caribbean. It is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant has opposite, simple, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It is a member of the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is known for its rapid growth and invasive tendencies in non-native regions. Lantana lockhardtii thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it adaptable to various environments.
